description: + Curb side pickup is available from over 20 local vendors. Check our market page for all available stores + support small businesses this holiday season. + Crokicurl is available for outdoor play for groups up to 8. Visit our Events + Experiences page to book your spot! + Takeout/delivery food + drinks are available on your favourite delivery or pickup app. + Holiday trees are available for pickup on weekends throughout December. Visit our Events + Experiences page for more information. All indoor + outdoor dining at stackt market is currently closed due to public health guidelines. Site is open Tuesday - Sunday from 12PM - 7PM for curb side pickups + Crokicurl. Check out our Instagram: @stacktmarket and website: www.stacktmarket.com for ongoing updates from our residents + community. We appreciate all the support and hope to see you all soon. Love, Team stackt

reviews.title: Great Place for Local Vendors
text: We were here for the Made in TO event and we sort of just stumbled on it after our Lyft driver drove by it. What a cool little place! So many local artists, vendors, DJs, and restaurant pop-ups/food trucks. Just a good little vibey place to walk around. I'm not sure what its like on a normal day though, but I assume the little local shops and vendors are there pretty often?

reviews.title: Containers are Stackt and make it unique
text: Went with a group of business associates and had some drinks and Boa‚Äôs which were really flavorful. Would be a great place to go with friends for a casual evening out and containers are all pretty cool being transformed for retail.

reviews.title: A fun night out!
text: We read about Stackt on the way to Toronto and so glad we made time to go! There‚Äôs really something for everyone, good food, drinks, shopping, desserts, pickle ball court, a bar, live music, it was so fun!! Lots of Insta worthy places within it too. We had tacos at Kongs Hot Tacos and they were really good! Definitely check it out.

reviews.title: Fun Outdoor Space
text: Stackt is an outdoor market filled with small shops, food, drinks and fun! The entire facility is designed from shipping containers. Their aim is to support local art, music, & cultural communities. It has many cool and colourful installations for photos, as well as games such as the bean bag toss.
Within the market I tried a taco food truck called Kong‚Äôs Hot Tacosü¶ç:
The tacos I tried were:
üåÆüå±Impossible Teriyaki
üåÆüêîGeneral Tso
üåÆüê∑The Island

I‚Äôve been to stackt a few time and the last time I was there during the evening. There ended up being a fun outdoor reggae party with a live DJ. If a DJ isn‚Äôt there, upbeat music usually is playing throughout the space. It‚Äôs a nice area for socializing with friends.

reviews.title: Love the set up
text: Spend a whole day there while attending an event. Love the setup and the variety in food and drinks. The skyline is amazing from this location and it fits very well with the overall look and feel. Properly enjoyed myself

reviews.title: Such a disappointment
text: We found this place mentioned online while looking for something to do near our air bnb in Harbourfront Toronto. We wandered in about 11.30am on a Friday. The place was totally dead and locked up. We walked around reading every sign. Nowhere was there any information about times! Every poster / calendar had dates and events but nowhere was there any information on opening times! Why on earth would you not advertise when stores are open!!? We peered in shop windows and walked around for 20mins then left, none the wiser as to when anything there would be open!! So disappointing!

reviews.title: A fun and unique location with a casual and creative energy
text: It‚Äôs quite deceiving how large this place is because the entrance area is so subtle.
Lots a space to wander around a explore boutique locations. We connected with friends and enjoyed snack and cocktails on a beautiful Friday evening in the city.

reviews.title: Fun outdoor
text: Stackt Market Is a fun outdoor market/park...a unique place to visit while in Toronto. There are plenty of areas where to seat and enjoy a sunny day with a freshly made fried chicken leg and a cold jug of beer.

reviews.title: More fun at a burial!!!!!!!!!
text: Don‚Äôt bother, unserved, unimpressed, not worth it

Honestly I wanted to love this place but the hostess was unwelcoming, the service was unavailable‚Ä¶..literally sitting at a table for 25 minutes now and had nothing better to do but write an honest review!  #iwishihadadrink

reviews.title: PATIO HOPPING AT STACKT!
text: Very cool concept. Shipping containers stacked one upon the other in an artistic fashion.Some even are painted.
Besides having several patios like Belgian Moon brewery, Jack Daniels, Noodle bar, Cointreau garden and more the area has several little shops and nail spas and a gym.
Very nice place to hang out with friends and family for snacks and drinks with fascinating views of the Toronto skyline!
You can tour the place in a snap, so to speak.
You have heard of bar hopping but this is a place where many enter to go "patio hopping" from one patio to the next.

reviews.title: Variety and quality
text: Food market with a wide variety of stalls and types of food, as well as the option to order and eat on site.

reviews.title: Good Drinks!
text: I had a great time here at Stackt! Although the fiod system is disorganized, they made for it with delicious drinks! So yummy!
It's a nice attraction and lots of little shops. My server, Danielle, was AMAZING!

reviews.title: Great concept!
text: I attended an event at Stackt.  The room it was held in was very nice.  The layout was great for a networking and presentations.  The only issue was it was very hot.  The space may have been too small for the amount of attendees.

I was really looking forward to finally visit stackt.  The concept is quite interesting.  It was a quick walk from Liberty Village.  I really enjoyed the outdoor concept and its a unique space to shop.  While it was nice to visit, you can tour the site fairly quickly.  I would go back but just for an hour or two.

reviews.title: Innovative Spot
text: Interesting area to take a quick walk through. Great pop up outdoor play area for kids. Lots of outdoor areas to sit and enjoy fine weather. More of a place to sightsee rather than shop. Very west coast feel to it.

reviews.title: Lots of see and do in a compact space
text: While Nuit Blanche was going on, this area was open for business from 7pm-7am so we decided to have a beer at the Belgian Moon Brewery.  The atmosphere was electric from the festival and the fact that it was an unusually warm evening for October.  Great area to sit in or out, and light beer-favourable snacks to choose from.  Also the little shops were open and it was definitely lots of fun, and a great find

reviews.title: Creative and Compact
text: The brewery is the anchor with a snack food section and large area to sit down. There are approximately one dozen independent vendors selling local products along with a contemporary gallery. The coffee shop and donut shop are small. Yummy. There are plenty of Instagram stations and spots with lots of colour and art. This is a fun and creative  way to use land space.
The containers are in good condition and, architecturally, laid out well. Worth the visit.

reviews.title: Lots of potential
text: Lots of potential in this creative marketplace! Just needs more vendors (and some of the vendors could use a bit more inventory). I hope it pulls in some more shops that will draw people in. The potential is there for this to be a great place!

reviews.title: Cool Vibe
text: Went opening weekend and there were lots of people, The vibe was pretty cool and there was lots of outdoor space.
They could certainly use more seating, and I can see it being absolutely packed in the summer.
Go while its fresh

reviews.title: So much potential!
text: This place just opened and I already loved it! There‚Äôs a lot of empty spaces that will be opening soon and a great outdoor area which will be awesome when the weather warms up. The Belgian Moon Brewery has a great vibe and I loved the mango beer! Huge outdoor area! We also had a delish cheesecake brownie donut from donut monster. Looking forward to summers on the brewery patio.

reviews.title: We went on a beautiful day. This will be a great destination in the upcoming warm weather
text: We saw the early open of this fun food, drink, and shopping destination. While there we say people of all ages and a lot of dogs. Everyone was enjoying the new space and the warm day. There were still a number of spaces not yet open but we could already see that this would be a fun place to check out. You can enjoy Donut Monster, Belgium Moon Brewery, coffee roaster Reunion Island and vegan ‚Äúbutcher‚Äù YamChops. More is coming and we are definitely planning on returning to see it in full bloom.

reviews.title: Stackt - Cool concept - market place in shipping containers
text: Cool new place - little shops in shipping containers, including Donut Monster, Endy mattresses, Belgian Moon brewery, Yamchops, etc. Great to visit - meet up with friends for a drink and gourmet donuts.
